bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.note: Index Bureau Dept of State Rec'd Feb 20 '99
div1.p:
No. 17, Consular Series.
Legation of the United States,
Monrovia Liberia,
Jan. 20, 1899.

Owen L. W. Smith
To
Hon. David J. Hill,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington.

Subject.
Advancements in local Consular Grades.

No. 17. Consular Series.
Legation of the United States
Monrovia Liberia,
Jan. 20, 1899.

Hon. David J. Hill,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington.

I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence, that the Belgium Government, during the year 1898, advanced its Vice-Consulate, here, from that of a Vice-Consulate to that of a Consulate, and appointed W. E. Dennis Esq. of Liberia Consul.

The Imperial German Government, which recalled her Vice-Consul, here, early in 1898, who had became gratia non persona, from efforts made by him, in the claims of his
his Government for indemnity, in December 1898; has recently advanced her Vice-Consulship to a Consulship, and has appointed Augustus Humplemayer Esq., a millionier; Imperial Consul to Liberia.
The Ecuadorian Government has recently appointed Hon. Thos., W. Howard, Treasurer of Liberia, Consul-General for Ecuador to Liberia.

Inclosure.
Letter of advice, as to drafts, Nos. 22, Jan. 19, 1899 and 23 Jan. 20, 1899.
